intro: Balsamiflua, commonly known as the balsam plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are characterized by their fragrant, resinous sap, which gives them their common name. They typically have evergreen foliage and produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or red. Balsamiflua species are often found in temperate regions and thrive in acidic, well-drained soils. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
